text: Alkisti Avramidou (; born 26 February 1988) is a female Greek water polo player currently playing as a left wing for Olympiacos and the Greek national team. Avramidou was part of the Greek national team awarded the Gold Medal at the 2011 World Aquatics Championships which took place in Shanghai in July 2011."Greece fends off China for women’s water polo gold" fina.org July 29, 2011 ==Club career== * 2007– Olympiacos Piraeus ==Club honours== ===Olympiacos=== * 1 LEN Euro League ** 2015."Olympiacos wins Euro League after thrilling final" waterpoloworld.com April 25, 2015. * 1 LEN Super Cup ** 2015."Olympiacos claims European Super Cup" waterpoloworld.com November 20, 2015. * 1 LEN Trophy ** 2014."Olympiacos wins LEN Trophy" waterpoloworld.com April 5, 2014. * 8 Greek Championships ** 2009, 2011, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018 and 2019. * 1 Greek Cup ** 2018. ==National team honours== * Gold medal ** World Championship (1): 2011 ** Europa Cup (1): 2018 * Silver medals ** European Championship (3): 2010, 2012, 2018 * Bronze medals ** World League (2): 2010, 2012 ** Mediterranean Games (1): 2018 ==See also== * List of world champions in women's water polo * List of World Aquatics Championships medalists in water polo ==References== ==External links== * * Alkisti Avramidou - athlete profile at Olympiacos SFP website * Category:1988 births Category:Living people Category:Greek female water polo players Category:Olympiacos Women's Water Polo Team players Category:World Aquatics Championships medalists in water polo Category:Mediterranean Games medalists in water polo Category:Mediterranean Games bronze medalists for Greece Category:Competitors at the 2018 Mediterranean Games Category:Sportspeople from Thessaloniki
title: Alkisti Avramidou
